WorkItem.Description: When I'm developing (in debug build configuration) I'd like to not have my JS in a mashed FileGroup minified. Rather than manually putting Minify="False" on each <File/> element, could Chirpy make the default False when in debug configuration?
WorkItem.Summary: Choose default setting of Minify based on build configuration

Comments.Message: Are you using T4MVC or is this not an MVC project?

I'm not using T4MVC.
However my project is an MVC project. How does this affect things?
Thanks.

Hey Andrew,

Not sure what Wayne was getting at with that one.

You could create two chirp.config files. The first mashes together all of the files; the second points to the first mashed file, and you specify that the created file should be minified.

Then, you can do a good old fashioned #if DEBUG conditional, swapping out the one mashed file for the other.

Does this solution not work for you? I can see what you've suggested as a nice feature, but I think it might complicate things a wee bit.

Cheers,
Evan

Oh, I think Wayne was referencing this article by David Ebbo:
http://blogs.msdn.com/b/davidebb/archive/2009/11/16/t4mvc-2-5-00-update-multiple-output-files-and-minified-javascript-support.aspx?wa=wsignin1.0

You can switch out a non-minified version of a file for a minified version with T4MVC. 

Cheers,
Evan
